dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During Brian's monologue, we see various views of things inside the school including Bender's locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday...March 24, 1984.  Shermer High School, Shermer, Illinois. 60062.  Dear Mr. Vernon...we accept the fact that we had to sacrifice a whole Saturday in detention for whatever it was that we did wrong, what we did was wrong.  But we think you're crazy to make us write this essay telling you who we think we are, what do you care?  You see us as you want to see us...in the simplest terms and the most convenient definitions.  You see us as a brain, an athelete, a basket case, a princess and a criminal. Correct?  That's the way we saw each other at seven o'clock this morning. We were brainwashed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see CLAIRE and her FATHER sitting in their car in the parking lot. Claire is the prom queen and is clearly a snob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you can't get me out of this...I mean it's so absurd I have to be here on a Saturday! It's not like I'm a defective or anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you...Honey, ditching class to go shopping doesn't make you a defective.  Have a good day. Claire rolls her eyes and gets out of the car and walks up the school front steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in BRIAN's car.  His MOTHER is there and so is his little SISTER.  He is sort of a nerd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the first time or the last time we do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last... BRIAN'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well get in there and use the time to your advantage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we're not supposed to study; we just have to sit there and do nothing. BRIAN'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well mister you figure out a way to study. BRIAN'S LITTLE SISTER (annoyingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! BRIAN'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well go! Brian gets out of the car and walks towards the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see ANDREW and his FATHER.  Andrew is clearly a jock; heВ’s wearing a lettermanВ’s jacket with lots of patches ANDREW'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I screwed around...guys screw around, there's nothing wrong with that.  Except you got caught, Sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom already reemed me, alright? ANDREW'S FATHER (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna miss a match?  You wanna blow your ride?  Now no school's gonna give a scholarship to a discipline case. Andrew gets out of the car and walks into the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see JOHN BENDER walking towards us.  He is wearing sunglasses.  A car is coming towards him but he doesn't stop walking. The car slams on its breaks directly in front of him. Bender gets out of the frame.  Out of the car steps ALLISON.  She is dressed all in black.  She steps forward to look in the car's front window and the car drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are six tables in two rows of three. Claire is sitting at the front table.  Brian comes in and sits at the table behind her. Andrew comes in and points at the chair next to Claire at the front table.  She shrugs and he sits there. In walks Bender, he touches everything on the checkout desk and takes a few things in the process. He walks over to where Brian is sitting and points to the table on the opposite side of the Library.  Brian reluctantly gets up and moves. Bender sits at the table where Brian was and puts his feet up. Allison walks in.  She walks all the way around the library and sits in the back corner table, just behind Brian. Andrew and Claire look at each other and snicker. Brian looks at her in confusion and then turns away. Enter RICHARD VERNON, a teacher.  He holds a stack of papers in his left hand.  He addresses the group with such disrespect it makes you wonder how he ever got the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...well.  Here we are!  I want to congradulate you for being on time... Claire raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir?  I think there's been a mistake.  I know it's detention, but...um...I don't think I belong in here... Vernon doesn't care.  He just continues to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now seven-oh-six.  You have exactly eight hours and fifty-four minutes to think about why you're here.  To ponder the error of your ways... Bender spits into the air and catches the spit in his mouth again. Claire looks like she is going to gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you may not talk.  You will not move from these seats. He glances up at Bender and points at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you... Vernon pulls the chair out from under Bender's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...will not sleep.  Alright people, we're gonna try something a little different today.  We are going to write an essay--of no less than a thousand words--describing to me who you think you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a test? Vernon passes out paper and pencils and takes no notice of Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I say essay...I mean essay. I do not mean a single word repeated a thousand times.  Is that clear Mr. Bender? Bender looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Maybe you'll learn a little something about yourself.  Maybe you'll even--decide whether or not you care to return. Brian raises his hand and then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I can answer that right now sir...That'd be "No", no for me. 'cause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down Johnson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir... He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office... Vernon points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is right across that hall.  Any monkey business is ill-advised... He looks around at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I got a question. Vernon looks at him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Barry Manilow know you raid his wardrobe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you the answer to that question, Mr. Bender, next Saturday. Don't mess with the bull young man, you'll get the horns. Vernon leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man...is a brownie hound... Everyone tries to get comfortable and we hear a loud snapping sound.  Brian turns and looks and it is Allison, biting her nails. Bender's eyes widen as he turns to look.  Everyone is looking now.  Allison notices them looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep eating your hand and you're not gonna be hungry for lunch... Allison spits part of her nail at Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen you before, you know... We see Vernon look out from his office. We see Brian playing with his pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do I think I am?  Who are you? Who are you? He attaches the pen to his bottom lip and puts the top under his upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a walrus... Bender looks at him in utter confusion.  Brian notices this, laughs and takes the pen out of his mouth-- embarrassed. Bender and Brian begin to take their jackets off at the same time.  They both notice this.  Brian stops removing his jacket. Bender takes his all the way off.  Brian rubs his hands together and pretends to be cold.  He pulls his jacket back on.  He turns and looks at Bender who is still staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the shits, huh? Bender glares at him and Brian utters an uncomfortable laugh. Bender turns away and crumples up his essay paper.  He throws it at Claire.  It misses and goes over Claire's head. Andrew and Claire acknowlege it but continue to ignore Bender. Bender starts loudly "singing" the musical part of a song.  В“Nah, nah, nah, nah, nah, nah...nah, nah, nah...В

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is really happening to me... Bender stops "singing" abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!  What're we s'posed to do if we hafta take a piss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you gotta go... We hear Bender unzip his fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go! Everyone is now looking at Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, yer not urinating in here man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk!  Don't talk!  It makes it crawl back up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You whip it out and you're dead before the first drop hits the floor! Bender gasps mockingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty sexy when you get angry...grrr! He turns to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, homeboy... Brian points at himself with his pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...why don't you go close that door. We'll get the prom queen-- impregnated! Claire turns and glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Bender ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I lose my temper, you're totalled man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just shut up!  Nobody here is interested!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really! (to Claire about Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buttface!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hey Sporto!  What'd you do to get in here?  Forget to wash your jock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me, fellas?  I think we should just write our papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just because you live in here doesn't give you the right to be a pain in the ass...so knock it off! Bender mockingly registers pain in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a free country...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just doing it to get a rise out of you!  Just ignore him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweets...you couldn't ignore me if you tried! Claire rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...so! (to Andrew and Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys like boyfriend/girl- friend? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady dates? (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo--vers? (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Sporto, level with me.  Do you slip her the hot...beef... injection? Claire and Andrew turn to face Bender, both furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Vernon in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What's going on in there? (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smug little pricks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at each other.  Andrew turns away from Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scumbag! Bender stands up and walks over to the railing.  He sits on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we close that door. We can't have any kind of party with Vernon checking us out every few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know the door's s'posed to stay open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you just shut up! There's four other people in here you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you can count.  See!  I knew you had to be smart to be a...a wrestler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you to judge anybody anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Bender...you don't even count.  I mean if you disappeared forever it wouldn't make any difference.  You may as well not even exist at this school. Bender probably is upset at this and he pauses a moment before speaking.  He doesn't let his emotions out, however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I'll just run right out and join the wrestling team. Andrew and Claire look at each other and laugh at Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the prep club too!  Student council...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they wouldn't take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why guys like you knock everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this should be stunning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 'cause you're afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock enthusiasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God!  You ritchies are so smart, that's exactly why I'm not heavy in activities!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big coward! Brian feels left out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one imparticular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the math club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you're afraid that they won't take you.  You don't belong so you just have to dump all over it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...it wouldn't have anything to do with you activities people being assholes...now would it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you wouldn't know...You don't even know any of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know any lepers either, but I'm not gonna run out and join one of their fucking clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey let's watch the mouth, huh? Brian again feels he needs to contribute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the physics club too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'cuse me a sec... (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you babbling about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what I said was...I'm in the math club, the Latin club and the physics club...physics club. Bender nods and turns to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...Cherry...do you belong to the physics club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an academic club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...academic clubs aren't the same as other kinds of clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but to dorks like him... Bender points at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they are. (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you guys do in your club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In physics, um, we ah, we talk about physics...about properties of physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's sorta social...demented and sad, but social.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I guess you could consider it a social situation.  I mean there are other children in my club and uh, at the end of the year we have, um, you know, a big banquet, at the, uh, at the Hilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You load up, you party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, we get dressed up...I mean, but, we don't...we don't get high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only burners like you get high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, uh, I didn't have any shoes. So I had to borrow my dad's.  It was kinda weird 'cause my mom doesn't like me to wear other people's shoes.  And, uh, my cousin Kent...my cousin Kendall from, uh, Indiana... He got high once and you know, he started eating like really weird foods.  And uh, and then he just felt like he didn't belong anywhere. You know, kinda like, you know "Twilight Zone" kinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you guys keep up your talking and Vernon's gonna come right in here...I got a meet this Saturday and I'm not gonna miss it on account of you boneheads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and wouldn't that be a bite... Bender lets out a moan of fake agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missing a whole wrestling meet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you wouldn't know anything about it, faggot!  You never competed in your whole life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know...I feel all empty inside because of it.  I have such a deep admiration for guys that roll around on the floor with other guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh...you'd never miss it.  You don't have any goals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be just--like--you!  I figure all I need's a labotamy and some tights! Brian becomes interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear tights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't wear tights, I wear the required uniform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! They hear Vernon moving around out in the hall so Bender quickly comes and sits in the chair between Claire and Andrew.  He folds his hands on the table. Vernon goes back into his office.  Bender laughs and gets up.  He starts walking towards the double doors that separate the library from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's not s'posed to be any monkey business! Bender turns and points at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a stern voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young man...have you finished your paper? Bender turns back away and goes to the door.  He looks around cautiously and removes a screw from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop dead, I hope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Vernon getting a drink at the fountain. He stands up and checks the way he looks in a mirror.  He does a muscular pose and utters some manly jibberish В“Cobadonga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks up.  Bender is messing with the door to the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bender, that's, that's school property there...you know, it doesn't belong to us.  It's something not to be toyed with. The door slams shut.  Bender runs back to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very funny, come on, fix it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should really fix that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a genius?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're an asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a funny guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fix the door Bender!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone just shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Vernon walking back to his office.  He stops and listens to them through the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been here before, I know what I'm doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Fix the door, get up there and fix it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Brian as we hear Vernon in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damnit! He opens the door and storms in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that door closed? For a few seconds no one says anything, they just stare at Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that door closed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're we s'posed to know?  We're not s'posed to move, right? Vernon turns to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just sitting here, like we were s'posed to... Vernon looks around and looks at Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who closed that door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think a screw fell out of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just closed, sir... Vernon looks at Allison in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Allison lets out a squeak and slams her face onto the table, hiding in her jacket hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't talk, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that screw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to yank you outta that seat and shake it out of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it...screws fall out all of the time, the world's an imperfect place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me, Bender...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, why would anybody want to steal a screw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, young lady... Vernon goes over to the door.  He tries to hold it open by putting a folding chair in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's way too heavy, sir. The door slams shut despite the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damnit! They laugh. Vernon opens the door again.  He comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew Clark...get up here.  Come on, front and center, let's go. Andrew gets up and walks over to Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how come Andrew gets to get up? If he gets up, we'll all get up, it'll be anarchy! Vernon and Andrew are now attempting to move the steel magazine rack in front of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now, watch the magazines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out of my hands... They get it into the doorway and it blocks the entire door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very clever sir, but what if there's a fire?  I think violating fire codes and endangering the lives of children would be unwise at this juncture in your career, sir. Vernon thinks about it.  He turns to Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, what are you doing with this?  Get this outta here for God's sake!  What's the matter with you? Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the school comes equipped with fire exits at either end of the library. Brian points at them and Bender glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show Dick some respect! Andrew and Vernon come back into the main section of the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go...go!  Get back into your seat. Andrew sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expected a little more from a varsity letterman! (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fooling anybody, Bender! The next screw that falls out is gonna be you! Vernon turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat my shorts... Vernon spins in his tracks and faces Bender again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat my shorts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just bought yourself another Saturday, mister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just bought one more right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm free the Saturday after that...beyond that, I'm gonna have to check my calendar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  'Cause it's gonna be filled, we'll keep goin'!  You want another one?  Say the word, just say the word!  Instead of going to prison, you'll come here!  Are you through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing society a favor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's another one, right now!  I've got you for the rest of your natural born life if you don't watch your step!  You want another one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it!  You got another one, right there!  That's another one pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out! Claire mouths the word "Stop" to Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close, bud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  You got one more, right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think I give a shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another... Bender glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's seven including the one when we first came in and you asked Mr. Vernon here whether Barry Manilow knew that he raided his closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's eight... (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay out of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, it's seven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Peewee! (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mine Bender...for two months I gotcha!  I gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say?  I'm thrilled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sure that's exactly what you want these people to believe.  You know something, Bender?  You ought to spend a little more time trying to do something with yourself and a little less time trying to impress people.  You might be better off. (to everyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, that's it!  I'm going to be right outside those doors.  The next time I hafta come in here...I'm cracking skulls!  (Bender mouths В“IВ’m cracking skullsВ”) Vernon leaves and closes the door.  A musical riff builds to a climax as Bender screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! We see the clock, it reads a quarter to eight. We see Bender, lighting his shoe on fire and lighting a cigarette with his shoe. We see Claire thinking. We see Brian playing with his balls. We see Andrew playing with his sweatshirt. We see Allison pulling a string around her finger and making it turn purple. We see Bender put the flames on his shoe out.  He then plays air guitar. We see Allison drawing. We see Andrew playing paper football.  He cheers silently. Allison shakes dandruff from her hair onto her picture. We see everyone fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Vernon is standing there staring at the sleeping kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!  Who has to go to the lavatory? Everyone raises their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. We see the clock, it now says 10:22. We see Andrew stretching.  We see Bender tearing pages out of a book.  He is tossing them around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's real intelligent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right...it's wrong to destroy literature... He continues to tear pages out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's such fun to read...and, Molet really pumps my nads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pronouncing it correctly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mol-yare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love his work. Bender tosses the rest of the pages at Brian.  He picks up the card catalogue drawer and begins to take cards out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal...nothing to do when you're locked in a vacancy..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'd speak for you?  I don't even know your language! Andrew turns to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you grounded tonight? Claire shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, my mom said I was but by dad told me to just blow her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big party at Stubbies, parents are in Europe.  Should be pretty wild...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, can you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well 'cause if I do what my mother tells me not to do, it's because because my father says it's okay. There's like this whole big monster deal, it's endless and it's a total drag.  It's like any minute... divorce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you like better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like your old man better than your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both strict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, if you had to choose between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, I'd probably go live with my brother.  I mean, I don't think either one of them gives a shit about me...it's like they use me just to get back at each other. Suddenly, from the back of the room.  Allison speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!!! Everyone looks at her shocked.  Allison blows her hair out of her eyes and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just feeling sorry for yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well if I didn't nobody else would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw...you're breaking my heart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sporto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Bender jumps down and goes next to Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get along with your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if I say yes, I'm an idiot, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an idiot anyway...But if you say you get along with your parents well you're a liar too! Bender turns and walks away from him.  Andrew follows and pushes Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something, man...If we weren't in school right now, I'd waste you! Bender points his middle finger at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear this?  Want me to turn it up? Bender flips his hand around so he is now giving Andrew the bird. Brian comes over and puts a hand on each of the guy's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey fellas, I mean... Andrew pushes away from Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't like my parents either, I don't...I don't get along with them...their idea of parental compassion is just, you know, wacko! Bender turns to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dork...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a parent's wet dream, okay? Bender starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's a problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can see you getting all bunged up for them making you wear these kinda clothes.  But face it, you're a Neo-Maxi-Zoom-Dweebie! What would you be doing if you weren't out making yourself a better citizen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to insult everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being honest, asshole!  I would expect you...to know the difference!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, he's gotta name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My condolences... Bender walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ka-Laire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...it's a family name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo...It's a fat girl's name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well not at present but I could see you really pushing maximum density! You see, I'm not sure if you know this...but there are two kinds of fat people.  There's fat people that were born to be fat, and then there's fat people that were once thin but they became fat...so when you look at them you can sorta see that thin person inside!  You see, you're gonna get married, you're gonna squeeze out a few puppies and then, uh... He mimes becoming fat, making noises. Claire gives him the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...obscene finger gestures from such a pristine girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resentfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that pristine! Bender bends down closer to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a virgin? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you a million dollars that you are!  Let's end the suspense! Is it gonna be... (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a white weddin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just shut up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever kissed a boy on the mouth? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been felt up?  Over the bra, under the blouse, shoes off...hoping to God your parents don't walk in? Claire is getting upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to puke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the panties, no bra, blouse unbuttoned, Calvin's in a ball on the front seat past eleven on a school night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone! Bender slowly stands and faces Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna make me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Bender walks over to where Andrew is standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and how many of your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just me, just you and me.  Two hits. Me hitting you, you hitting the floor!  Anytime you're ready, pal! Bender goes to hit him but Andrew gets Bender down on the ground with a wrestling move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna get into to this with you man... Andrew gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Bender gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I'd kill you...It's real simple. I'd kill you and your fucking parents would sue me and it would be a big mess and I don't care enough about you to bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken shit... Andrew turns and walks away.  Bender takes out a switchblade and opens it. He stabs the switchblade into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's end this right now.  You don't talk to her...you don't look at her and you don't even think about her! You understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to help her!. We see the janitor, CARL come into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad works here? Brian is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does one become a janitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be a janitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I just wanna know how one becomes a janitor because Andrew here, is very interested in persuing a career in the custodial arts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really?  You guys think I'm just some untouchable peasant?  Peon? Huh?  Maybe so, but following a broom around after shitheads like you for the past eight years I've learned a couple of things...I look through your letters, I look through your lockers...I listen to your conversations, you don't know that but I do...I am the eyes and ears of this institution my friends.  By the way, that clock's twenty minutes fast! Everyone groans.  Bender smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock says 11:30.  Vernon gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bender starts to whistle a marching tune and everybody joins in. Vernon enters.  Bender begins to whistle Beethoven's 5th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allright girls, that's thirty minutes for lunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I think the cafeteria would be a more suitable place for us to eat lunch in, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't care what you think, Andrew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Dick?  Excuse me, Rich...will milk be made available to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're extremely thirsty sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a very low tolerance for dehydration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen her dehydrate sir, it's pretty gross. Bender stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, I'll get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ah, ah grab some wood there, bub! Bender grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, I was born yesterday?  You think I'm gonna have you roaming these halls? He points at Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! He points at Allison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you!  Hey!  What's her name? Wake her!  Wake her up! (to Allison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, on your feet missy!  Let's go!  This is no rest home! Allison gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a soft drink machine in the teacher's lounge.  Lets go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and Allison are walking in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's your poison? Allison doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you drink? Allison still doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...forget I asked... Allison waits for two beats and then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka?  When do you drink vodka?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot? Allison smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you're here today? Allison doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? Allison snaps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? They stop walking and Andrew leans against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I'm here today...because uh, because my coach and my father don't want me to blow my ride.  See I get treated differently because uh, Coach thinks I'm a winner.  So does my old man.  I'm not a winner because I wanna be one... I'm a winner because I got strength and speed.  Kinda like a race horse. That's about how involved I am in what's happening to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  That's very interesting. Now why don't you tell me why you're really in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Bender and Brian are all sitting around waiting for the Cokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...you wanna see a picture of a guy with elephantitus of the nuts? It's pretty tasty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think he rides a bike? Claire rolls her eyes and turns away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Claire...would you ever consider dating a guy like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just leave me alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean if he had a great personality and was a good dancer and had a cool car...Although you'd probably have to ride in the back seat 'cause his nuts would ride shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I wish I was doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Op, watch what you say, Brian here is a cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cherry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was on a plane to France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When have you ever gotten laid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've laid, lotsa times!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives in Canada, met her at Niagra Falls.  You wouldn't know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever laid anyone around here. Brian shushes Bender and points at Claire whos back is still turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you and Claire, did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin', nothin! (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just drop it, we'll talk about it later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Drop what, what're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Brian's trying to tell me that in addition to the number of girls in the Niagra Falls area, that presently you and he are, riding the hobby horse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not!  I'm not!  John said I was a cherry and I said I wasn't, that's it, that's all that was said!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then what were you motioning to Claire for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I don't appreciate this very much, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you weren't motioning to Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he's lying, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you or were you not motioning to Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it was only...was only because I didn't want her to know that I was a virgin, okay? Bender just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for being a virgin, I'm sorry... Claire laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you want me to know you were a virgin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's personal business, it's my personal, private business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Brian, it doesn't sound like you're doing any business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's okay for a guy to be a virgin... Bender looks suprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Claire smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Everybody has lunches now. Claire begins to take hers out of a small shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess, where's your lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wearing it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nauseating... Bender grabs a Coke and tosses it over to Allison who catches it without even looking up. Bender then watches Claire set up a sushi platter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sushi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sushi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice, uh, raw fish and seaweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't accept a guys tongue in your mouth and you're gonna eat that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...give it a try... We now watch Andrew take a couple sandwiches out of his bag, a bag of potato chips, an apple, a banana, a bag of cookies and a carton of milk. Allison opens her Coke and it fizzes over.  She loudly slurps it up off the table and her fingers. Andrew sees Bender looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem? Allison opens her sandwich and and tosses the meat up. It lands on the sculpture above. She opens some pixie stix and pours the sugar on the sandwich and then puts Cap'n Crunch on top of that. She crushes the sandwich together and loudly eats it. Bender goes over and sits by Brian, Bender takes Brian's bag lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we having?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it's your standard, regular lunch I guess... Bender reaches in the bag and pulls out a thermos.  He sets it on the table and points at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soup. Bender goes in again and pulls out a juice box. Brian reaches toward the bag and Bender slaps his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's apple juice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can read!  PB & J with the crusts cut off...Well Brian, this is a very nutritous lunch, all the food groups are represented.  Did your mom marry Mr. Rogers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, Mr. Johnson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh.... Andrew and Claire smile at each other.  Bender stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my impression of life at big Bri's house... (in a loud and friendly voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son! (in a kiddie voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Dad? (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your day, pal? (kiddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Dad, how's yours? (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super, say son, how'd you like to go fishing this weekend? (kiddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Dad, but I've got homework to do! (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright son, you can do it, on the boat! (kiddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geee!!! (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear, isn't our son swell? (quiet and motherly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Dear, isn't life swell? Bender mimes mother kissing father and then father kissing mother and then father punching mother in the face. Suddenly it's not so funny anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, what about your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's real easy! Bender stands again and points forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as his father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid, worthless, no good, God damned, freeloading, son of a bitch, retarded, bigmouth, know it all, asshole, jerk! (as his mother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot ugly, lazy and disrespectful. Bender slams his hand back to slap his invisable mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as his father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up bitch!  Go fix me a turkey pot pie! (as himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you Dad? (as his father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! (as himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad, what about you? (as his father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! (as himself--yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad, what about you? (as his father--yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! He reaches out and pretend he's his father hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that for real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come over sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.  It's all part of your image, I don't believe a word of it. Bender actually looks hurt. BENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I stutter? Bender comes over to Andrew and rolls up his right sleeve to reveal a circular shaped burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe this?  Huh?  It's about the size of a cigar...Do I stutter?  You see, this is what you get in my house when you spill paint in the garage. Bender begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See I don't think that I need to sit here with you fuckin' dildos anymore! Bender walks over to a map table and throws all the maps on the floor.  He climbs up on top of the table and then up to the second floor balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have said that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would I know, I mean he lies about everything anyway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon puts an orange in his mouth and then attempts to pour coffee out of his thermos.  The top comes off and the coffee goes all over his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon walks into the hallway, talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee...looks like they scrape it off the bottom of the Mississippi river.  Everything's polluted, everything's polluted...the coffee. Bender comes out of the library doors followed bye veryone else. Bender and Claire are walking next to each other. Brian and Andrew are walking next to each other and at th end of the line, Allison is following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know where Vernon went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, how do you know when he'll be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...being bad feels pretty good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point in going to Bender's locker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so stupid...Why do you think, why are we risking getting caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then what are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask me one more question and I'm beating the shit out of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Bender opens his locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My maid's on vacation. Bender pulls out a bag of marijuana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw that Bender...put it back! Bender walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs...the boy had marijuana. Claire walks after Bender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was marijuana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Andrew follows the other two.  Brian looks at Allison who is standing there with her mouth open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you approve of this? Brian turns and leaves.  Allison steals the lock off of Bender's locker. We see the crowd walking down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cross through the lab, and then we'll double back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be right, if Vernon cuts us off it's your fault, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?  Where're we going? They see Vernon down one of the halls.  We have various sequences of them running around and seeing Vernon until they stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Wait, hold it!  Hold it!  We have to go through the cafeteria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the activities hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, you don't know what you're talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't know what you're talking about! Allison squeaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're through listening to you, we're going this way. They all go Andrew's way and run into a hall closed by an iron gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great idea Jagoff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!  Why didn't you listen to John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to the library, keep your unit on this! Bender puts his bag of marijuana into Brian's underwear. Bender runs away singing loudly.  В“I wanna be an airborne ranger...В” We see Vernon hear Bender. The rest of them run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch! We see Vernon looking for Bender until he finds him in the gym. Bender is going up for a basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...two...one! He dunks the ball.  Vernon enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bender!  Bender!  Bender!  What is this?  What are you doing here, what is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out!  That's it Bender!  Out, it's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you wanna hear my excuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking of trying out for a scholarship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimmie the ball, Bender. Bender fakes the ball at Vernon.  He then sets the ball down and rolls it at Vernon who kicks it back at him. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the kids are all sitting back in their seats when Bender and Vernon enter.  Vernon pushes Bender

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your stuff, let's go! (to everyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wiseguy here has taken it upon himself to go to the gymnasium.  I'm sorry to inform you, you're going to be without his services for the rest of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vernon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's a big joke, huh Bender? The false alarm you pulled, Friday, false alarms are really funny, aren't they...What if your home, what if your family... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what if your dope was on fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible, sir...It's in Johnson's underwear... Andrew laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's funny?  You think this is cute?  You think he's bitchin', is that it?  Lemme tell you something.  Look at him, he's a bum. (to everybody)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna see something funny?  You go visit John Bender in five years! You'll see how God damned funny he is! (to Bender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, John?  You gonna cry?  Let's go... Vernon grabs Bender's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey keep your fuckin' hands off me! I expect better manners from you, Dick! Bender takes his sunglasses out of his pocket and lays them in front of Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For better hallway vision! Bender leaves but not before pushing stuff over on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon has put Bender in a closet and is in there talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last time, Bender.  That's the last time you ever make me look bad in front of those kids, do you hear me?  I make $31,000 dollars a year and I have a home and I'm not about to throw it away on some punk like you...But someday, man, someday. When you're outta here and you've forgotten all about this place... And they've forgotten all about you and you're wrapped up in your own pathetic life...I'm gonna be there. That's right.  And I'm gonna kick the living shit out of you, man, I'm gonna knock your dick in the dirt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do about it?  You think anybody's gonna believe you? You think anybody's gonna take your word over mine?  I'm a man of respect around here.  They love me around here, I'm a swell guy...you're a lying sack of shit!  And everybody knows it.  Oh, you're a real tough guy...come on, come on...get on your feet, pal!  Let's find out how tough you are!  I wanna know right now, how tough you are!  Come on! I'll give you the first punch, let's go!  Come on, right here, just take the first shot!  Please, I'm begging you, take a shot!  Come on, just take one shot, that's all I need, just one swing... Bender just sits there staring at Vernon.  Vernon fakes a punch and Bender flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I though...you're a gutless turd! Vernon leaves and locks the closet door after him. Bender climbs into a hatch in the ceiling and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bender is slowly crawling through a heating duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A naked blond walks into a bar, with a poodle under one arm and a two foot salami under the other.  She lays the poodle on the table.  Bar- tender says: "I suppose you won't be needing a drink."  The naked lady says... The ceiling under Bender gives and he falls through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the door to the bathroom.  We hear Vernon inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, allmighty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bender walks down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot my pencil... We hear Vernon in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damnit!  What in God's name is going on in here? Vernon enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that ruckus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what ruckus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just in my office and I heard a ruckus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you describe the ruckus, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your tongue young man, watch it! We see Bender under the table by Claire's legs.  He sits up and bangs his head on the table.  He groans. Above the table, Andrew and Claire try to take credit for the noise by making more noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?  What, what is that, what is that noise? Under the table, Bender looks between Claire's legs and can see her panties.  He puts his head between Claire's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, sir, there wasn't any noise... Claire squeels.  She squeezes Bender's head between her knees. Everyone starts faking a coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That noise?  Was that the noise you were talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't.  That was not the noise I was talking about.  Now, I may not have caught you in the act this time, but you can bet I will. Allison laughs at Vernon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make book on that missy! (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you!  I will not be made a fool of! He turns and walks away.  We see that he still has the toilet seat cover stuck to his pants. Vernon leaves. Everyone laughs except Claire who lets Bender out to a barage of slaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sue me... Bender gets up and walks over to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Ahab...Kybo Mein Doobage... Brian gives Bender his bag of marajuana.  Bender turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo waistoid...you're not gonna blaze up in here! Claire gets up and goes after him.  Then Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Andrew goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Vernon go down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, Bender and Claire are sitting in a circle and laughing hysterically. Bender lights Claire up and she coughs the smoke out. Brian laughs at her.  He exhales and tries to eat the smoke.  He talks in a really weird voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicks, cannot hold der smoke!  That's what it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how popular I am?  I'm so popular, everybody loves me so much, at this school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor baby. Brian waves Claire over to him and he falls over. We see Andrew emerge from a really smokey room.  He inhales another puff and then starts dancing to everybody's applause. He goes back in the room he was in.  He screams and it shatters the glass in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon is glancing through the confidential files in the school basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, oh mister Tearney...a history of slight mental illness? Wooh, no wonder he's so fucked up! Carl enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon, Dick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Carl, how you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, what's happening, what are you doing in the basement files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothin' nothin' here.  I'm just doin' a little homework here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homework, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Carl, laughing, comes over and looks at the files that Vernon was looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confidential files...hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Carl...this is a highly sensitive area and I, I tell you something...certain people would be very very embarrassed.  I would really appreciate it if if if if this would be something that, that you and I could keep between us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do for me, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well what would you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got fifty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Andrew and Brian laughing.  Allison is hanging out over by the statue in the back of the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no man, no; you got a middle name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, guess... Allison suddenly takes interest in the conversation and as she speaks, she moves over and sits next to the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your middle name is Ralph, as in puke... Brian and Andrew look at her in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...your birthday is March 12th, you're five-nine and a half you weigh a hundred and thirty pounds and your social security number is 0-4-9-3-8-0-9-1 (a beat)
Andrew is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  Are you psychic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well would you mind telling me how you know all this about me? Allison reaches in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stole your wallet... She produces it in her hands and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it! Allison reluctantly hands over the wallet and Brian glances through it to make sure nothing is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great...you're a thief too! Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a thief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multi-talented!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there to steal?  Two bucks and a beaver shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a nudie picture in there! I saw it, it's perverted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's see it! We see Bender, he is brushing his teeth with one of Claire's cosmetic brushes. We see Claire looking through Bender's wallet pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are all these your girlfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, some I consider my girlfriends and some...I just consider...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether or not, I wanna hang out with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in just one guy, one girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...that's the way it should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Bender clearly doesn't want to answer that.  He acts defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you got so much shit in your purse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you got so many girlfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...I guess I never throw anything away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... We cut back to where Andrew, Brian and Allison are sitting, Andrew is looking through Brian's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the worst fake ID I've ever seen... Brian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize you made yourself sixty eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know...I know, I goofed it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need a fake ID for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like it's obvious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can vote! Allison looks up suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna see what's in my bag? BRIAN & ANDREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Allison looks hurt and then resentful.  Just to spite them, she dumps the contents of her bag onto the couch. Lots of stuff comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!  What is all that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always carry this much shit in your bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I always carry this much shit ...in my bag...You never know when you may have to jam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna be like a shopping bag lady?  You know like, sit in alleyways and like talk to buildings and wear men's shoes and that kinda thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I have to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with feeling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My home life is un...satisfying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying you'd subject yourself to the violent dangers of the Chicago streets because your homelife is unsatisfying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to run away and live in the street...I can run away and, go to the ocean, I can go to the country, I can go to the mountains. I can go to Israel, Africa, Afghanistan... Brian looks at her and then moves over to Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy...you wanna get in on this? Allison here says, she wants to run away, because her home life is unsatisfying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well everyone's home lives are un- satisfying...If it wasn't, people would live with there parents forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah I understand.  But I think that her's goes beyond, you know, what guys like you and me... consider normal unsatisfying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind...forget it, everything's cool! Allison starts putting everything back in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  There's no deal, Sporto. Forget it, leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, now you're carrying all that crap around in your purse. Either you really wanna run away or you want people to think you wanna run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat shit! Allison gets up and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is an island, with herself. Okay? Andrew gets up and goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, you wanna talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want me to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO away! Andrew turns away and Allison starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have problems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I have problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do everything everybody ever tells you to do, that is a problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine...but I didn't dump my purse out on the couch and invite people into my problems...Did I? So what's wrong?  What is it?  Is is bad?  Real bad?  Parents? Allison is silently crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Andrew nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ignore me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...yeah... They both are crying silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernon and Carl are sitting talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you want to be when you were young?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, I wanted to be John Lennon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl don't be a goof!  I'm trying to make a serious point here...I've been teaching, for twenty two years, and each year...these kids get more and more arrogant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw bull shit, man.  Come on Vern, the kids haven't changed, you have! You took a teaching position, 'cause you thought it'd be fun, right? Thought you could have summer vacations off...and then you found out it was actually work...and that really bummed you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These kids turned on me...they think I'm a big fuckin' joke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...listen Vern, if you were sixteen, what would you think of you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...Carl, you think I give one rat's ass what these kids think of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think about this...when you get old, these kids; when I get old, they're gonna be runnin' the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is the thought that wakes me up in the middle of the night... That when I get older, these kids are gonna take care of me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't count on it! Vernon ponders that statement for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are sitting on the floor in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would I do for a million bucks? Well, I guess I'd do as little as I had to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's boring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how'm I s'posed to answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea is to like search your mind for the absolute limit.  Like, uh, would you drive to school naked? Andrew laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, uh...would I have to get out of the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the spring, or winter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter...spring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the school or in back of the school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do that! They all look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do anything sexual, I don't need a million dollars to do it either...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have...I've done just about everything there is except a few things that are illegal...I'm a nymphomaniac! Claire rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your parents aware of this?
